New Records: Domantas Sabonis set a new record with 28 rebounds, the most by a Kings player against the Celtics since Ben Wallace in 2002
Key Match Events: Sacramento outscored Boston by 17 points in the fourth quarter
Celtics struggled from the free throw line (7-for-17)
15 turnovers by Boston led to key Sacramento baskets
Devin Carter's back-to-back threes and subsequent layup keyed the Kings' fourth-quarter surge
Post-Match Reflections: Joe Mazzulla criticized the team's inefficient offense and defensive lapses
Jaylen Brown and Kristaps Porzingis expressed confidence in bouncing back from the loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sacramento, under interim coach Doug Christie, have won six consecutive games
Celtics are dealing with injuries and lineup shuffles, impacting their performance
